newsitem.title: USA: Ford Motor sets vehicle recalls.
newsitem.headline: Ford Motor sets vehicle recalls.

text.p: Ford Motor Co said Thursday it is recalling 134,800 Ford Explorer, Ranger, Aerostar and F-Series pickup trucks because safety certification labels list the wrong rear tire inflation pressure level.
The recall involves 1996 model year Explorers, Rangers and Aerostars, and F-Series trucks from the 1996 and 1997 model years.
Ford said it is also recalling 148,000 1997 model year F-150 pickup trucks because they have have a loose or missing seat belt anchorage bolt.
Ford said 10,000 of the F-150 trucks are located in Canada.
In another recall involving 1997 F-150 pickups, Ford said trucks with 4.6 liter engines are being called back to install a foam insulating sleeve on the positive crankcase ventilator (PCV) tube.

Ford said ice may form in the throttle body when the trucks are operated at highway speeds over a long period of time in temperatures below minus-20 degrees Fahrenheit. That could prevent the engine returning to idle and the vehicle not slowing down or stopping as expected.
There are 27,900 trucks affected by the action, 13,900 of which are in Canada.
Ford said it is recalling 57,900 1996 Econoline and Club Wagon vehicles because the parking brakes may not meet hill- hold requirements in the U.S. and Canada. Of those, 4,100 are in Canada.
